paper_abstract: Let G be a simple graph with n vertices, and let lambda(1) (G), lambda(2)(G),..., lambda(n)(G) be its eigenvalues. The resolvent Estrada index of G is defined as EEr(G) = Sigma(n)(i=1) (1-lambda(i)(G)/n - 1)(-1) In this paper, we show that EEr(G) can be determined directly by the characteristic polynomial of the graph G. By using this result, we determine the first thirteen trees with the greatest resolvent Estrada index, and characterize the multipartite graphs having the maximal resolvent Estrada index.
